terms.नात्मा: नाम् (naam) means "named" or "called", and आत्मा (aatma) means "the Self" or "the soul". Here, नात्मा refers to the ignorant person or the non-hearer, who does not have knowledge of the scripture or the Vedic texts.
terms.अश्रुतेः: अ (a) is a negation indicating "non-" or "not", and श्रुति (shruti) means "the scripture" or "the Vedic texts". अश्रुतेः means "of the non-hearer" or "of the one who is ignorant of the scriptures".
terms.नित्यत्वात्: नित्य (nitya) means "eternal" or "unchanging", and त्वा (tva) indicates "due to" or "because of". नित्यत्वात् means "due to eternity" or "because it is eternal".
terms.ताभ्यः: ता (taa) means "from them", and अभ्यः (abhya) means "from". ताभ्यः means "from them" or "from those (previous mentioned sources)".

meaning: श्रुति के द्वारा उल्लिखित है आत्मा का जन्म भी नहीं है मृत्यु भी नहीं है आत्मा किसी कारणांतर से नहीं आता और स्वयं भी अन्य किसी का कारण नहीं है शरीर नष्ट होने पर भी येह शरीर के साथ नष्ट नहीं होता, इसी से वेद कहता है
